timeline.message: Fixed typo in JavaDoc of getApp
parse completedAt and startedAt into Date in getters

timeline.body: I assume that empty line is not needed.
timeline.bodyText: I assume that empty line is not needed.
timeline.bodyHTML: I assume that empty line is not needed.
timeline.author: recena

timeline.body: These can be `Date` instances I think and Jackson will handle the conversion.
timeline.bodyText: These can be Date instances I think and Jackson will handle the conversion.
timeline.bodyHTML: These can be Date instances I think and Jackson will handle the conversion.
timeline.author: bitwiseman

replies.bodyText: I just saw the GHObject uses String for such timestamps at first and convert them into Date in getters. And I think if we want to get rid of setters, we may have to do it in this way, or we will get error messages from spot-bugs like may expose internal representation.
replies.author: XiongKezhi

timeline.body: I think the `htmlUrl` and `getHtmlUrl()` can be inherited from `GHObject`.   Please confirm.
timeline.bodyText: I think the htmlUrl and getHtmlUrl() can be inherited from GHObject.   Please confirm.
timeline.bodyHTML: I think the htmlUrl and getHtmlUrl() can be inherited from GHObject. Please confirm.
timeline.author: bitwiseman

replies.bodyText: We can inherit the url and getUrl, but the getHtmlUrl() is abstract in GHObject, so I have to overwrite it.
replies.author: XiongKezhi

timeline.author: bitwiseman

timeline.body: Do we have a `CheckRunAnnotations` yet? If not we'll need that added eventually as well.
timeline.bodyText: Do we have a CheckRunAnnotations yet? If not we'll need that added eventually as well.
timeline.bodyHTML: Do we have a CheckRunAnnotations yet? If not we'll need that added eventually as well.
timeline.author: bitwiseman

replies.bodyText: That's where I'm confused. The response (or event payload) from GitHub does not include annotation objects, but they are needed when users are making requests. So does our implementation have to make sure it supports both usages?
replies.author: XiongKezhi

replies.bodyText: Most probably it should support. Would be beneficial for users in the longer term
replies.author: sladyn98

replies.bodyText: It isn't required for this PR, I'm just noting it for later.
replies.author: bitwiseman

timeline.message: using Date for timestamps and add more JavaDoc
Change timestamps property back to String

timeline.body: @XiongKezhi I guess there are multiple states of the check run that need to be tested for, Is this the only one?
timeline.bodyText: @XiongKezhi I guess there are multiple states of the check run that need to be tested for, Is this the only one?
timeline.bodyHTML: @XiongKezhi I guess there are multiple states of the check run that need to be tested for, Is this the only one?
timeline.author: sladyn98

replies.bodyText: Yeah, that's one thing we can do. Before, I just changed the original JSON in order to cover more methods for convenience, but later I found more sample responses here, they are much better and maybe we can use them later.
replies.author: XiongKezhi

timeline.message: Fixed JavaDoc warning reported by maven site

timeline.bodyHTML:
This is why you want some "recursive" testing. You couldn't know this was needed, but it will be for anyone wanting to take further actions from this repository instance. (see https://github.com/github-api/github-api/pull/723/files#diff-0848153dca0376dad295a4c0fd4a9437R232)

Suggested change
return repository;
repository.root = root;
return repository;
timeline.author: bitwiseman

timeline.body:
I don't see it on this page: https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/commits/#get-a-single-commit 

I see this:
https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/events/types/#webhook-payload-example-1

It possible the "issue" in `GHCheckSuite` is not a `GHCommit`?  But instead something else?
